thread.title: Beacon beats Millsboro Middle 1-0 in battle of unbeaten hockey teams
thread.title_full: Beacon beats Millsboro Middle 1-0 in battle of unbeaten hockey teams

author: newsroom@capegazette.com (Dave Frederick )
title: Beacon beats Millsboro Middle 1-0 in battle of unbeaten hockey teams
text:
Beacon beats Millsboro Middle 1-0 in battle of unbeaten hockey teams Elliot goal, Stancofski defense the difference By Dave Frederick | Oct 20, 2015 Photo by: Dave Frederick Teammates congratulate Beacon's Ryleigh Elliot after she scored a goal in the first half. 
Beacon field hockey played Millsboro Middle School Oct. 19, under crisp, cool and bright blue conditions. Both teams were undefeated, Beacon at 6-0 having outscored opponents 30-1. 
Millsboro was on the rise at 5-0 with a 25-1 advantage over opponents in goals scored. 
The game attracted a crowd most high schools never see for afternoon weekday games. The game was a Sussex County style happening. 
Beacon emerged victorious, 1-0, which doesn’t sound exciting unless you have blood in the game and realize that every hit and possession were crucial in an evenly played contest. 
The freshly cut grass field was undulating and the ball rolled slowly. Beacon put on the pressure in the first half when defender Ryleigh Elliot cranked a high shot from up top off a corner that went “boom” for a huge 1-0 lead heading into halftime. 
The second half was all about protecting the house for Beacon, and defender Anna Stancofski was all about it, slowing down drives and making stops throughout the second half. 
Millsboro put the ball on the Beacon front porch several times in the second half, but couldn’t get through the front door. 
Beacon goalies Autumn Davis and Marlee Geppert shared in the shutout victory. 
Beacon has four games remaining including a season-ending contest Wednesday, Nov. 4, versus Mariner at Champions Stadium. Millsboro swarms in front of the Cape cage late in the game. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Lola Messick crosses sticks knowing if the ball hits her foot it goes the other way. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Autumn Davis saves a shot, (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Beacon was all about protecting its lead in the second half. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Monday afternoon crowd for Millsboro Middle School field hockey game. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Ryleigh Elliot is a hard hitter from up top on corners. (Photo by: Dave Frederick ) Anna Stancofski, right, was Beacon's defensive star of the game. (Photo by: Dave Frederick )
